text: Zanqufa (, also spelled Zanqufeh) is a village in northwestern Syria, administratively part of the al-Haffah District, located northeast of Latakia. It is situated along the southern edge of city of al-Haffah. According to the Syria Central Bureau of Statistics, Zanqufa had a population of 928 in the 2004 census.General Census of Population and Housing 2004. Syria Central Bureau of Statistics (CBS). Latakia Governorate. During the 1919-20 revolt against French rule in Syria, Zanqufa was used as a base of guerrilla operations and training by rebel leader Izz ad-Din al-Qassam.Schleifer, 1993, p. 169. ==References== ==Bibliography== * Category:Populated places in al- Haffah District
title: Zanqufa
